elements.name: question1
elements.title: What is meant by "coding" in communication theory?
elements.correctAnswer: The encryption of a message, for example by means of linguistic characters.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Under what conditions can an interaction be successful?
elements.correctAnswer: If the encoded (encrypted) message can be correctly decoded (decrypted).

elements.name: question3
elements.title: When is it not possible to communicate on a linguistic level?
elements.correctAnswer: When the sender and receiver speak completely different languages.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: What are symmetrical and asymmetrical relationships?

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Which of the two forms do relationships such as boss/student and teacher/schoolchildren belong to?

elements.name: question7
elements.title: Self-disclosure is one of the four sides of the communication square. What are the other three sides?

elements.name: question8
elements.title: What is meant by self-disclosure?
elements.correctAnswer: When communicating, the person sending the message shows a part of themselves, of their personality.

elements.name: question9
elements.title: What is the difference between an explicit and an implicit appeal?
elements.correctAnswer: The explicit appeal is direct, open; the implicit appeal is indirect, hidden.

elements.name: question10
elements.title: How should requests be formulated when communicating with customers?
elements.correctAnswer: As direct (explicit) appeals - and still friendly

elements.name: question11
elements.title: What does the relationship ear type focus on first and foremost?
elements.correctAnswer: On how someone says something and on the relationship with others.

elements.name: question12
elements.title: What is the motto for projections? Add. What I do with myself ...
elements.correctAnswer: can't stand it, I'll stick it to someone else.
